title: Sans-serif with distinct 'A'
content:
Looking for the name of this typeface, don't really have much else to go on but this image.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131827im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_4374.png)

Font: 

 Alien League 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131827/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131827/http:/typophile.com/files/1_31.png) | 150.68 KB |
author: wearebadluck

comments.content:
Similar: [Director's Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131827/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lettering-inc/directors-gothic/?refby=bowfin). The A could be made with inverted V, but the numerals are not exactly the same. Old Image Club font [Pacifica Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131827/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/pacifica-condensed/?refby=bowfin) has the A, but is more squared.

Could be custom design for the phone app.

- Mike Yanega

It looks like **[Alien League](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317131827/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=Alien%20League%20-%20Regular&fid=6c231d42868e5c7826ac7c8607d428cb&fsize=60&text=3%3A50%2C%202014%20MOSTLY%20CLOUDY%20email&wrap=2)** by Daniel Zadorozny [Iconian Fonts, 1999, Donationware]  
The strange /A is the lowercase /a glyph
This is it. Thanks so much!
